intro: Bouchetia erecta, commonly known as the erect bouchetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Bouchetia erecta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
